text.text_translated:
Zoos have important new jobs.
They help animals have babies. This is called a breeding programme.
Many countries work together on these programmes.
They are for endangered species. A species is a type of animal.
Endangered means there are very few of them.

In nature, some endangered species are very few.
They cannot find a partner easily.
They cannot have babies easily.
Bad people also kill them. These people are poachers.
Animals lose their natural home. This home is where they live.
Other animals eat them. These animals are predators.

A good zoo helps these endangered species.
They can live there.
They can have babies there.
It is a safe place for them.

Also, the number of wild animals goes down.
So, animals in one group become too much like each other.
This is a danger for the animal group.
Their families become too similar.

Breeding programmes help with this danger.
They are a safeguard. A safeguard is a plan to keep something safe.
Animals from zoos can go back to nature.
They help the wild animals to be more different.
This makes their families stronger and healthier.

best_attempt.text_translated:
A `species` is a group of animals or plants that are the same kind.

Zoos do important work now. They help animals have babies. This is for many countries. It is especially for `species` in danger.

In nature, some `species` are very rare. They cannot find a partner easily. They cannot have babies easily. Also, bad people hunt them. They lose their homes. Other animals hunt them.

A good zoo helps these `species`. They can live there. They can have babies there. It is a safe place.

Also, fewer wild `species` live in nature. So, the animals become too much alike. This is a problem for their family.

Having babies in zoos helps. Animals from zoos can go back to nature. This makes the animal families more different. This is good for them.
